title: Training and Research visa (subclass 402)
summary: This page provides information for holders and former sponsors of the now-closed Training and Research visa (subclass 402). It explains visa validity, rights, obligations, and sponsor requirements. It also outlines alternative visas available since the closure of subclass 402.

suggested_if: participate in classroom based professional development programme
academic invited to collaborate in a research project by an Australian tertiary or research institution
student or recent graduate undertaking research related to field of study at an Australian tertiary or research institution
elite sportsperson participating in high level sports training

visa_holders.purpose: Information for people already granted a Training and Research visa (subclass 402)

occupational_trainee_and_research_stream.requirement: must lodge a new application from within Australia
occupational_trainee_and_research_stream.additional_notes: Occupational trainee stream applicants might need to explain why they could not complete training within the initial period

professional_development_stream.restriction: cannot apply or reapply for this visa while in Australia

general: enter Australia at any time after visa grant if outside Australia
stay in Australia for nominated duration
travel to and from Australia multiple times until the program ends or visa expires

conditions: might need to enter or leave Australia with you
must remain members of your family unit

general: comply with visa conditions and Australian laws

must: not perform work other than approved training
not become unemployed or work a second job
not undertake activities affecting participation in training
inform sponsor if personal circumstances change or concerns arise
occupational_trainee_stream.changing_organisation: new organisation must lodge a nomination; once approved, training can continue without new visa
occupational_trainee_stream.if_sponsor_ceases_training: must notify the department and find a new sponsor
occupational_trainee_stream.family_work_rights: family members cannot work more than 40 hours per fortnight

must: continue in the position for which visa was granted
not work outside approved research duties
engage only in activities specified in application
conduct research only for sponsoring employer
not become unemployed or work elsewhere
research_stream.if_sponsor_ceases_employment: must notify department and find another sponsor

must: participate fully in professional development program
not pay participant costs that sponsor is liable for

must_notify: changes to phone number, email, address or passport

sponsor_information.purpose: Information for approved sponsors of subclass 402 visa holders

sponsorship_status.new_sponsorship: cannot apply to sponsor new applicants because visa is closed

transitional_arrangements.transitional_period_end: 18 May 2017 or when sponsorship approval ceases, whichever is earlier
transitional_arrangements.from_19_may_2017: must apply online for approval as a temporary activities sponsor

applications_lodged_before_19_november_2.validity: sponsorship only valid to sponsor new subclass 407 or 408 applications until 18 May 2017

general_obligations: notify department when certain events occur
provide records and information to the Minister
not recover or transfer certain costs
pay costs to locate and remove an unlawful non-citizen
ensure visa holder participates in nominated occupation, program, or activity
stream_based_obligations: secure offer of reasonable standard of accommodation
pay travel costs for sponsored people to leave Australia
sponsor_obligations.responsibility_note: Sponsor remains responsible even if another person acts on their behalf, including migration agents
